title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 604.6 - Hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 604.6 - Hearing

State Regulations

At the hearing all interested parties may be heard, whether
in favor of or in opposition to the matter. The prior filing of objections is
not obligatory. The sworn testimony of witnesses in support of the contentions
of petitioner must be given and such testimony in opposition will be received. A stenographic transcript of all testimony will be required. Unsworn statements
may be made, but the speakers shall be asked to file briefs embodying their
statements and arguments. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
604.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
